result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincent A. Simone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Seek and maintain employment.  Not to terminate employment without agent's prior approval.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.
May apply for expungement, if he successfully completes probation.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Follow through with any treatment or therapy currently participating in.  If agent recommends, attend anger management counseling.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in court with Attorney Dominguez.  Defendant plead no contest to charge.    Victim notification complied with where appropriate.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the count he is pleading to.  He understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty as plead to.  Joint recommendation for 1 years probation.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  AODA assessment.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Anger management if agent recommends.  s/m employment.  Eligible for expungement if he successfully completes probation at age 25.  Defendant elect did not exercise his right to allocution.  

Court ordered sentence withheld, 1 year probation.   Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Follow through with any treatment or therapy currently participating in.  AODA assessment.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Anger management if agent recommends.  Seek and maintain employment.  Not to terminate without agent's prior approval.  Defendant may apply for expungement if he successfully completes probation.  CC
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Dominguez.  Set for plea/snetencing 1/4/16 at 1:30 pm

Defendant appeared with counsel Alyssa Dominguez.  Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  He also had a bond to return 9-15-15 at 1:00 for possible new charges.  ADA Inlow states they have not received reports and likely will not be able to get complaint filed by tomorrow.  Return date on bond is adjourned to 9-21-15 at 9:30 and this case is to track.  Defendant is notified to re-apply with the SPDO for the new case.

Report for booking.    No violent, abusive, threatening or disorderly contact with:  M.S.  or C. P.    Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.
